name: appalachian
content:

from or relating to the mountain region of Appalachia in the eastern United States, that includes parts of many different states and that is regarded as having its own culture: I am Appalachian and bean soup was a staple food in our family. His family has worked in the Appalachian coal industry for generations. She is fascinated by the links between traditional Appalachian music and the folk songs of Ireland and Scotland. Related word

More examplesFewer examplesThe network has 14 clinics that offer medical and dental services in the Appalachian region.He had grown up in a traditional Appalachian culture that was rapidly disappearing.As a local historian, he knew that telling stories was the Appalachian way of connecting the past and the present.This is Dorothea Lange's famous photograph of an Appalachian woman during Depression times. When I was growing up, people seemed to be ashamed of the idea of being Appalachian.
